model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Have you talked to your advisor about your career options? Teaching is probably a good idea since it is a more guaranteed job.
Speaker B: Yes, I did talk to my advisor and it was very stressful. Deciding my whole life when I am really unsure! But I think I will get into teaching, it is a stable career.
Speaker A: It sounds like something that you would really like and be good at! I hope it works out. I would love to teach robotics someday.
Speaker B: That is so cool, you must be really smart! I imagine your parents are so proud.
Speaker A: Well I'm studying computer science and learning a lot! My parents are great, they are very supportive. What subject would you want to teach?
Speaker B: I would probably teach English, just because that is most in line with what I am studying. However, I have recently started becoming more interested in history so that is also an option.

[MEMORY]
Speaker B wants to turn their linguistics major into a practical job, while Speaker A wants to develop apps for differently abled youth through studying computer science. Speaker A is interested in teaching computer science, specifically in the field of robotics. 
Speaker A is working at a pizza shop to pay for college and studying computer science, while Speaker B is considering further education to become a college professor in linguistics, feeling limited in job opportunities.

raw_prediction: Teaching English or history could be a great fit for you. It's always good to have options to explore!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The information from memory can be referenced to add more depth to the conversation, especially regarding the ambitions of speaker A and B. The memory does not only mention their career interests that correlate to their college major, Speaker A: Computer Science and Speaker B: English or History, but also provides some extra information about them like how Speaker A is working at a pizza shop to pay for college which could be woven in future responses carefully to feel more personalized.
Judgement: Yes
